table.name: user_ws_report_access
table.description: Records the reports that a user wants in their workspace.

columns.name: USER_ACCESS_GID
columns.description: Defines the visibility of the workspace records.  What this means is that a user_access_gid may be associated with a specific user, a gl_level, or an entire domain.  The UI will choose the most granular level of user_access to show to the user.  So, if a user wants to create his own workspace, the user_access_gid will have the GL_USER populated, and the user_ws_report_access table will define the list of reports for this workspace.  If the user does not create his own workspace, the UI will search at the GL_LEVEL or DOMAIN level to see if a report workspace has been created.

columns.name: REPORT_GID
columns.description: Defines a report within the user's workspace.

columns.name: ICON_GID
columns.description: The icon, or image, associated with the report (foreign keys to ICON table).  The image will appear in the user's workspace.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Domain of the User. Is used for creating the GID.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: For audit trail purposes. This field stores the id of the user who first entered the record.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: For audit trail purposes. This field stores the date and time when the record was first entered in the database.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: For audit trail purposes. This field stores the id of the user who last updated the record.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: For audit trail purposes. This field stores the date and time when the record was updated in the database.
